\chapter{Search}
\label{\detokenize{searchdb:search}}\label{\detokenize{searchdb::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Search for any shabad in the BaniDB API

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{banidb}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{search}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{query}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{searchtype}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{source}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{all}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{larivaar}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{False}\PYG{p}{,}
           \PYG{n}{ang}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{raag}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{writer}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{all}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{page}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{l+m+mi}{1}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{results}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{None}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Return a dictionary of search results.
\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters:}}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{query} \sphinxstyleemphasis{(str or int)} \textendash{} what you want to search.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{searchtype.html}{searchtype} \sphinxstyleemphasis{(int)} \textendash{} how you want to search (first letter, word, ang, etc).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{sources.html}{source} \sphinxstyleemphasis{(str)} \textendash{} from where you want to search (by default, Guru Granth Sahib Ji).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{larivaar} \sphinxstyleemphasis{(bool)} \textendash{} you want it to be in larivaar or not.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{ang} \sphinxstyleemphasis{(int)} \textendash{} specify the ang to search from, for more precise results.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{raag} \sphinxstyleemphasis{(int)} \textendash{} specify the raag for your search.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{writers.html}{writer} \sphinxstyleemphasis{(int)} \textendash{} specify the banikaar, writer of the specific bani.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{page} \sphinxstyleemphasis{(int)} \textendash{} specify page of search results.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{results} \sphinxstyleemphasis{(int)} \textendash{} specify number of results you want.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Returns:}    Search Results as dictionary(key\sphinxhyphen{}value pair).

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Return type:}    dict


\section{Example}
\label{\detokenize{searchdb:example}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Searching Bandhana Har Bandhana Gun Gaavo Gopal Rai....}
\PYG{n}{shabad\PYGZus{}data} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{banidb}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{search}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{l+s+s2}{bhbgggr}\PYG{l+s+s2}{\PYGZdq{}}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{shabad\PYGZus{}data}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\chapter{Shabad}
\label{\detokenize{shabad:shabad}}\label{\detokenize{shabad::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Get Shabad using its corresponding Shabad ID

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{banidb}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{shabad}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{shabad\PYGZus{}id}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{larivaar}\PYG{o}{=}\PYG{k+kc}{False}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Return a dictionary of search results.
\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters:}}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{shabad\_id} \sphinxstyleemphasis{(int)} \textendash{} id of the specific shabad, recieved from the \sphinxhref{searchdb.html}{search} results.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{larivaar} \sphinxstyleemphasis{(bool)} \sphinxhyphen{} you want it to be in larivaar or not.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Returns:}    Specific Shabad as a dictionary(key\sphinxhyphen{}value pair).

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Return type:}    dict

            \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{ur}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:} \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{ساںایں مےرَے چںگا کیِتا ناهیِ ت هں بھیِ دجھاں آه ۔۔۳۔۔}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}
        \PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
    \PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}\PYG{p}{]}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\chapter{Hukamnama}
\label{\detokenize{hukamnama:hukamnama}}\label{\detokenize{hukamnama::doc}}
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] Get Hukamnama Sahib of any specified date after 01/01/2002
\item[] When no parameters are provided, it automatically gives the Hukamnama Sahib of current date, according to the availability and your Time Zone.
\end{DUlineblock}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} Get Hukamnama for a specific date}
\PYG{n}{data} \PYG{o}{=} \PYG{n}{banidb}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{hukamnama}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{year}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{month}\PYG{p}{,} \PYG{n}{day}\PYG{p}{)}
\PYG{n+nb}{print}\PYG{p}{(}\PYG{n}{data}\PYG{p}{)}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Returns Hukamnama Sahib.
\begin{description}
\item[{\sphinxstylestrong{Parameters:}}] \leavevmode\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{year} \sphinxstyleemphasis{(int)} \textendash{} \sphinxstyleemphasis{\{Optional\}} year of the hukamnama.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{month} \sphinxstyleemphasis{(int)} \textendash{} \sphinxstyleemphasis{\{Optional\}} month of the hukamnama.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{day} \sphinxstyleemphasis{(int)} \textendash{} \sphinxstyleemphasis{\{Optional\}} day of the hukamnama.

\end{itemize}

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{Return type:}    dict

\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] \sphinxstylestrong{Output}
\item[] The hukamnama sahib data can be accessed as follows:
\end{DUlineblock}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{p}{\PYGZob{}}
    \PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{l+s+s1}{hukam}\PYG{l+s+s1}{\PYGZsq{}}\PYG{p}{:}\PYG{p}{[}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{p}{]} \PYG{c+c1}{\PYGZsh{} List of all shabads(if more than one) in shabad format.}
\PYG{p}{\PYGZcb{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxhref{shabad.html}{Shabad} format

\chapter{Vision Statement}
\label{\detokenize{index:vision-statement}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
BaniDB’s vision is to create a single, universally accessible Gurbani
Database for Sikh websites and applications. BaniDB is, and will
continue to be, the most accurate and complete Gurbani database ever
created for use by Sikhs around the world.

\sphinxAtStartPar
In order to make this vision possible, members of this collaborative
effort work to ensure that the platform is self\sphinxhyphen{}sustaining, tested, and
secure.

\section{Release}
\label{\detokenize{index:release}}

\subsection{Checkout the main branch}
\label{\detokenize{index:checkout-the-main-branch}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{git} \PYG{n}{checkout} \PYG{n}{main}
\PYG{n}{git} \PYG{n}{pull}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsubsection{Increment the version}
\label{\detokenize{index:increment-the-version}}
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] Pick one of the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{major|minor|patch}} to update
\item[] For example, let’s release the version to 0.4.0
\end{DUlineblock}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{bump2version} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{allow}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{dirty} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{verbose} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{commit} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{tag} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{new}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{version} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.4}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0} \PYG{n}{patch} \PYG{n}{setup}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For minor

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{bump2version} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{allow}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{dirty} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{verbose} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{commit} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{tag} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{new}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{version} \PYG{l+m+mf}{0.4}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0} \PYG{n}{minor} \PYG{n}{setup}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
For major

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{bump2version} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{allow}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{dirty} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{verbose} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{commit} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{tag} \PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{new}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{version} \PYG{l+m+mf}{1.0}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{l+m+mi}{0} \PYG{n}{major} \PYG{n}{setup}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{py}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\sphinxAtStartPar
Note: its always good to start with the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\sphinxhyphen{}\sphinxhyphen{}dry run}} first


\subsection{Push to remote}
\label{\detokenize{index:push-to-remote}}
\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{git} \PYG{n}{push}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}

\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] Push the tag to remote too
\item[] in our case 0.4.0 \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{git push origin 0.4.0}}
\end{DUlineblock}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{git} \PYG{n}{push} \PYG{n}{origin} \PYG{o}{\PYGZlt{}}\PYG{n}{tag}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{name}\PYG{o}{\PYGZgt{}}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}


\subsubsection{Run the github release action}
\label{\detokenize{index:run-the-github-release-action}}

\subsubsection{From UI}
\label{\detokenize{index:from-ui}}
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] This will upload the bits to pypi.org
\item[] It can be done from the UI. Select the tag we just created and pushed
\end{DUlineblock}


\subsubsection{From CLI (untested)}
\label{\detokenize{index:from-cli-untested}}
\begin{DUlineblock}{0em}
\item[] \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{gh}} has a new feature to trigger workflow from the CLI.
\item[] Note: at the time of writing this doc, this feature was not working on MacOS
\end{DUlineblock}

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{n}{gh} \PYG{n}{workflow} \PYG{n}{run} \PYG{n}{python}\PYG{o}{\PYGZhy{}}\PYG{n}{publish}\PYG{o}{.}\PYG{n}{yml}
\end{sphinxVerbatim}
